session_analysis.discussion_quality: Rich and thoughtful discussion with multiple perspectives explored.
key_moments: Maya initiates a list of what the community lost, prompting deeper analysis.
teacher_recommendations: Encourage Alex to speak up more frequently, as their contributions are valuable.

positive_patterns: Students frequently built on each other's ideas and referenced specific text pages.

discussion_behavior.response_rate: Consistently engaged with peers' ideas and facilitated deeper discussion.
discussion_behavior.contribution_to_environment: Maya frequently validated others' points and encouraged further exploration of ideas.

examples: "I see what you mean, Sam. That's a really valid point about war."
"Let's make a list. What did they lose?"
"I think both things can be true. We can improve society without it ever being completely perfect."
"Good catch with the page reference, Casey."
"That's a really good point, Jordan. The freedom thing is huge."

students.overall_impression: Maya demonstrated strong leadership and facilitation skills, encouraging peers to explore complex ideas deeply.
growth_indicators: Continued to validate and build on peers' ideas, fostering a collaborative environment.

discussion_behavior.response_rate: Frequently engaged with peers' ideas, often challenging and expanding the discussion.
discussion_behavior.contribution_to_environment: Sam brought a critical perspective, prompting peers to consider alternative viewpoints.

examples: "I think they did. War is horrible. My grandpa was in a war and he says it was the worst thing ever."
"But someone has to try, right? If not him, then who?"
"Yeah, actually. Like, we should keep trying even if we can't fix everything."
"Wait, is that supposed to be like him having feelings for her? Because that's another thing they try to control - who you can like."
"That's what I'm saying! It's all or nothing. They had to go all the way to make it work."

students.overall_impression: Sam was an active participant, often challenging ideas and prompting deeper consideration of the text's themes.
growth_indicators: Demonstrated increased willingness to consider peers' perspectives.

discussion_behavior.response_rate: Consistently engaged with peers' ideas and facilitated connections between different points.
discussion_behavior.contribution_to_environment: Jordan frequently built on others' ideas, enhancing the depth of discussion.

examples: "Whoa, Casey. That's kind of pessimistic but also maybe realistic?"
"Building on that, maybe that's what happened to the last Receiver. Maybe she tried to change things and that's why it failed?"
"Yeah, I'm starting to lean that way too. Like, at first I thought safety was more important, but now I'm not so sure."
"Sam's bringing up a good point. What's the actual trade-off here?"
"I mean, Sam has a point. But also, they don't get to choose anything. Jonas can't even pick his own job."

students.overall_impression: Jordan effectively connected ideas and perspectives, enhancing the group's understanding of the text.
growth_indicators: Continued to build on peers' contributions, fostering a collaborative discussion.

discussion_behavior.response_rate: Frequently posed thoughtful questions and engaged with peers' ideas.
discussion_behavior.contribution_to_environment: Casey asked probing questions that deepened the group's analysis.

examples: "I guess I never thought about it that way. I was just thinking about the safety aspect."
"What do you guys think the previous Receiver failed at? The one from ten years ago?"
"I keep going back and forth. Part of me thinks they should have found a middle ground somehow."
"The lying one is huge! Everyone else has to tell the truth always."
"That part was really powerful. It says on page 94 that he sees the apple change."

students.overall_impression: Casey contributed significantly by asking insightful questions that prompted deeper reflection.
growth_indicators: Continued to ask questions that challenged the group's assumptions.

discussion_behavior.response_rate: Engaged more as discussion progressed, contributing thoughtful observations.
discussion_behavior.contribution_to_environment: Alex's contributions, though less frequent, were insightful and added depth to the discussion.

examples: "I'd be really scared if I were him. Finding out your whole life is going to be different from everyone else's."
"And the capacity to receive pain. That's kind of scary."
"Me too."
"Animals. They don't have real animals anymore, just those weird comfort objects."
"I don't know... it seems kind of sad."

students.overall_impression: Alex's contributions were valuable and demonstrated empathy, though they could benefit from more frequent participation.
growth_indicators: Showed increased engagement and willingness to express personal insights.
